title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 33.5 - Claims for reimbursement
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 33.5 - Claims for reimbursement

State Regulations

Counties and towns whose equipment has been deployed by the
commissioner for the cleanup and removal of petroleum discharges may apply to
the commissioner for reimbursement of all costs incurred in such cleanup and
removal, including the reasonable costs of equipment usage and the salaries and
overhead of the operators. Reimbursement of such costs, where applicable, shall
be based upon the equipment rates and such other approved rates which may have
been or which may be established by the department. The commissioner shall
examine such claims and certify such claims as are just to the administrator
for payment. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
